text: Kim Vincent Fowley (July 21, 1939 - January 15, 2015) was an American record producer, singer and musician. He was best known for his role behind a string of novelty and cult pop rock singles in the 1960s, and for managing The Runaways in the 1970s. He was born in Los Angeles, California. Fowley died of bladder cancer in West Hollywood, California at the age of 75. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Fowley's MySpace page * "Dead Man Rockin'" Interview with Kim Fowley 2013 Rocker Magazine Category:1939 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Deaths from bladder cancer Category:Singers from Los Angeles Category:Musicians from Los Angeles Category:Singer-songwriters from California Category:American record producers Category:American pop singers Category:American pop musicians Category:American rock singers Category:American rock musicians Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:American punk musicians
title: Kim Fowley
